pynav.utils¶

Classes:

GaussianResult

A data container that simultaneously computes various interesting metrics about a Gaussian filter’s state estimate, given the ground-truth value of the state.

GaussianResultList

A data container that accepts a list of GaussianResult objects and stacks the attributes of each object numpy arrays.

MonteCarloResult

A data container which computes various interesting metrics associated with Monte Carlo experiments, such as the average estimation error squared (EES) and the average normalized EES.

Functions:

monte_carlo

Monte-Carlo experiment executor.

randvec

Produces a random zero-mean column vector with covariance given by cov

plot_error

_summary_

plot_meas

Given measurement data, make time-domain plots of the measurement values and their ground-truth model-based values.
class pynav.utils.GaussianResult(estimate: pynav.types.StateWithCovariance, state_true: Optional[pynav.types.State] = None)¶

class pynav.utils.GaussianResultList(result_list: List[pynav.utils.GaussianResult])¶

Bases: object

A data container that accepts a list of GaussianResult objects and stacks the attributes of each object numpy arrays. Convenient for plotting.

class pynav.utils.MonteCarloResult(trial_results: List[pynav.utils.GaussianResultList])¶

Bases: object

A data container which computes various interesting metrics associated with Monte Carlo experiments, such as the average estimation error squared (EES) and the average normalized EES.

nees_lower_bound(confidence_interval: float)¶
nees_upper_bound(confidence_interval: float, double_sided=True)¶
pynav.utils.monte_carlo(trial: Callable[[int], List[pynav.utils.GaussianResult]], num_trials: int)¶

Monte-Carlo experiment executor. Give a callable trial function that executes a trial and returns a list of GaussianResult.

pynav.utils.randvec(cov: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Produces a random zero-mean column vector with covariance given by cov

pynav.utils.plot_error(results: pynav.utils.GaussianResultList, axs: Optional[List[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes]] = None, label=None, sharey=False, color=None) → Tuple[matplotlib.figure.Figure, List[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes]]¶

Parameters

  • axs (List[plt.Axes], optional) – _description_, by default None

  • label (_type_, optional) – _description_, by default None

  • sharey (bool, optional) – _description_, by default False

  • color (_type_, optional) – _description_, by default None

Returns

  • plt.Figure – _description_

  • List[plt.Axes] – _description

pynav.utils.plot_meas(meas_list: List[pynav.types.Measurement], state_true_list: List[pynav.types.State], axs: Optional[List[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes]] = None, sharey=False)¶

Given measurement data, make time-domain plots of the measurement values and their ground-truth model-based values.
